name: Early-Window Collab Exclusives
description: Shoppers are shifting to hunt curated, partner-led exclusives in early holiday windows rather than waiting for blanket sitewide markdowns. Limited co-branded drops concentrate buyer intent and shift purchases earlier in the funnel, protecting margin compared with open discounts.
operator_move: Operator move: Brand Partnerships run a 2-week co-branded early exclusive (owner: Brand Partnerships; window: Nov 29–Dec 12); target early_window_share 20–30% and QR_redemption ≥5%.
operator_scan: Measure early-window sales share for co-branded SKUs versus sitewide promos.
spine_hook: Exclusive collabs pull purchases earlier, not cheaper.

name: Collab Events Drive Measurable Footfall
description: Short, experiential in-store collaborations produce concentrated foot-traffic spikes that out-perform equivalent blanket discounts on conversion per visit. When paired with a simple QR capture, these events generate traceable buyer journeys and higher-quality sales.
operator_move: Operator move: Store Ops and Marketing run three weekend collab activations across representative stores (owner: Store Ops; window: next 6 weeks); target foot_traffic_uplift base 10–15% with stretch ≥25% and QR_redemption ≥5%.
operator_scan: Track weekend footfall lift and QR captures versus matched non-event weekends.
spine_hook: Experiential collabs lift footfall and capture buyers at higher quality.

name: Tiered Collab-Linked Discounts Replace Blanket Cuts
description: Volume price curve approaches let you give meaningful perceived discount while protecting margin by tying discount depth to bundle size or partner-led SKU sets. Replacing a flat sitewide cut with tiered collab offers concentrates value for engaged buyers and reduces overall promo leakage.
operator_move: Operator move: Merch and Pricing A/B test replacing a sitewide 20% off with tiered collab bundles (owner: Merch+Pricing; window: 6 weeks); target event_cpa ≤0.80x baseline while holding blended margin neutral.
operator_scan: Compare CPA, margin, and buyer share for tiered collab bundles versus sitewide coupon.
spine_hook: Tiered bundles concentrate discount to active buyers, protecting margin.

name: Store-as-Studio Content Series
description: Micro-influencer-led in-store content series convert store visits into media moments that increase early-window share and lower effective CPA when content drives immediate, trackable offers. This approach turns physical space into a repeatable media channel without constant price cuts.
operator_move: Operator move: Marketing and Store Ops run a 4-episode store-as-studio content series with micro-influencers (owner: Marketing; window: next 6 weeks); aim to lift early_window_share to 20% and keep event_cpa ≤0.8x baseline.
operator_scan: Measure content-driven visit rate, conversion, and CPA versus paid media spend.
spine_hook: Turns stores into repeatable media that shift purchase timing.

name: News-Driven Discount Windows
description: Macro shocks and noisy policy developments create discrete windows where price sensitivity spikes and blanket discounts are expected. Timing targeted, partner-led offers into these windows yields stronger conversion at lower promotional depth than maintaining constant sitewide cuts.
operator_move: Operator move: Marketing concentrate limited-time partner offers on high-news days after tariff or shutdown headlines (owner: Marketing; window: now through next 6 weeks); measure event_cpa and foot_traffic_uplift against baseline.
operator_scan: Correlate daily news spikes with promo conversion and footfall.
spine_hook: Macro news creates short high-sensitivity windows for targeted offers.
